item.title: Rubbish dumps by residents living at no.40 marvels lane, 19th June
item.description:

item.title: Overflowing bin amd Dangerous Bush, 19th June
item.description:
Number 132 green top bin full of rubbish that shouldn't be in there and been outside their house 8 weeks now!! Remove the whole bin and fine them and maybe they will stop. Whilst there get them to cut back their overgrown bushes that have been an eyesore for about 18 months and now have sharp hard spikes sticking out on to the path. A child could seriously hurt themselves. Start enforcing your tenancy and leasehold terms for the minority like this along the road that can't be bothered to clean and maintain a small garden.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 130,132, Kingsground, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins at 48 Rudloe, 19th June
item.description:
Hi This has been reported before but the bins belonging to 48 Rudloe road are just constantly left on the pavement. They are never returned to their front garden following any bin collection.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rudloe Road, Clapham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple cars parked over pavement (as usual), 19th June
item.description:
Multiple parks parked on the pavement opposite to Perandori, snooker club, Alfre Herring Park. This is a standard antisocial behaviour of the regular clientele. Given recent shootings, stabbings, and the violent incident this morning involving a 14 year old, I would urge the council to be more present and upfront with any antisocial behaviour like this one. People are afraid to speak and take pictures, but the events explain it all.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lanes, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox found in the garden, 19th June
item.description:
Last night I found a dead fox in my garden, my landlady has contacted people from the council and they told us to remove that dead fox and keep it near the bins of your house in the morning so they can clear it. Its still hasn't been cleared yet.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 480, Footscray Road, New Eltham, London
